metadata.proposal_title: Mineral Discovery through Supercomputing and Generative AI

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
Train UNET-3D and SWIN-UNETR networks on
synthetically generated 3D datasets

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
A large synthetically generated 3D voxel dataset of subsurface geologies, including many volumes at 64×64×64 and 256×256×256 resolution with structures like faults, folds, dikes, and in at least one setup two channels (density + magnetic susceptibility). 
It is used to train / pre-train and later fine-tune the project’s geology foundation model and to support physics-based inversion + mineral exploration / prediction workflows.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No explicit mentions or stated use-cases involving military, weapons, nuclear, surveillance, or intelligence were found in the proposal’s dataset description sections.

checks.name: D5+M Affiliation Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes: The dataset is described as generated in-house by the project team (KAUST/KSL context), and the proposal does not provide any LinkedIn links for dataset owners/maintainers.

checks.name: Provenance
checks.notes: Provenance is in-house creation via a geological simulation/data-generation pipeline, and maintenance appears to remain with the same project team, with no external curator named.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
Research-use only (explicitly stated). 
Not published / not public for download (explicitly stated; URL field is blank). 
No formal open-source/open-data license is named in the proposal (only the “research purposes only – not published” statement)

observations:
1. The software listed is very minimal - only PyTorch and no docker images specified.
2. No datasets are specified only Synthetically generated 3D samples
of subsurface geologies.
